Can this be the meaning of St. James‘e What was the general feelingvof the Jews about cui-sing? The old law required the Israelite to curse on Mount Ebal and ble‘ss on Mount Gerizim. The fact too that cursing was forbidden in special cases, as against parents (Exod. xxi. 17), the king (ib. xxii. 28), the deaf (Lev. xix. 14), seems to show that it was not generally condemned under the old dispensation. It is referred to without implying blame, Prov. xi. 26, xxiv. 24, xxvi. 2, xxx. 10, Ε66166. vii. 21, x. 90. Compare also the curse of Canaan by Noah (Gen. ix. 25), that of Simeon and Levi by their father (Gen. xlix. 7), of the builder of Jericho by Joshua (Josh. vi. 26), Abimelech by Jotharn (Jud. ix. 20, 57), Meroz by Deborah (ib. v. 23), the children by Elisha (2 Κ. ii. 24), apostate Jews by Nehemiah (Neh. xiii. 25), and the imprecations in the Psalms.
